name: Tab
slogan: Tab helps tourist businesses to take bookings and get paid, all over the world
description:
We're a fintech company that powers travel & tourism businesses in 40 countries across Latin America, Africa and Asia. Our software and payment platform helps tourism businesses to save on payment costs, manage and take bookings more flexibly – while spending less time on admin and more time with their customers.

We work with hotels (from budget to boutique) and activity operations like dive schools, surf lodges and yoga retreats.

Our platform is trusted hundreds of tourism businesses around the world, and we've helped hundreds of thousands of travellers to pay in over 100 currencies.

We're working on ambitious plans to revolutionise the experience of independent travel – by helping travellers make the most of their precious time abroad, and giving local tourism operators the vital tools they need to run their business.

team.name: Chris Wood
team.bioHtml: Founder & CTO at Tab • CTO at Revector • Studied at @University of Cambridge

team.title: Co-founder & CEO
team.name: Mark Datta
team.bioHtml: CEO/Founder at Tab • Product @Ocado & @Funding Circle • @Boston Consulting Group • Studied at @Harvard Business School, @University of Cambridge

team.name: Chris Wood
team.bioHtml: Founder & CTO at Tab • CTO at Revector • Studied at @University of Cambridge

jobs.title: Growth & Ops Team
jobs.description:
About Tab

We're a YC-backed fintech company that powers travel & tourism businesses in 40 countries across Latin America, Africa and Asia. Our software and payment platform helps tourism businesses to save on payment costs, manage and take bookings more flexibly – while spending less time on admin and more time with their customers. 

We work with hotels (from budget to boutique) and activity operations like dive schools, surf lodges and yoga retreats. Our initial focus is emerging destinations, in countries where payment and booking systems are a significant challenge.

Our platform is trusted hundreds of tourism businesses around the world, and we've helped hundreds of thousands of travellers to pay in over 100 currencies.

We're working on ambitious plans to revolutionise the experience of independent travel – by helping travellers make the most of their precious time abroad, and giving local tourism operators the vital tools they need to run their business.

We're primarily based in London, and we're backed by Y Combinator (the investors behind Airbnb, Dropbox and Stripe). Our team has deep expertise across travel, finance and technology – with previous experience at Cambridge University, Harvard and BCG.

About the Role

This is an exciting opportunity to join the early team at Tab. You'll have the chance to learn directly from the founders (ex-Cambridge, BCG, HBS & Y Combinator) as Tab executes its ambitious growth plan.

We move fast, so you'll start having a meaningful impact on the business in your first week. You'll also be encouraged to contribute across all areas – we all help each other out.

You'll divide your time between Growth (helping to acquire new businesses and expand our platform) and Operations (managing our relationships with businesses and making sure critical operations run smoothly). You'll help to design and build the products and processes that enable us to continue scaling rapidly, while improving our product experience and maintaining a high level of empathy for our customers who use Tab every single day.

This role is full of variety – here's a few things you could be working on:

* Talking to prospective customers, to understand how their tourist business works and explain how Tab can benefit them.
* Visiting one of the countries where we operate, to spend face-to-face time with new and prospective customers.
* Helping to launch new products/features on our platform quickly, and eliciting the feedback needed to make them 10x better.
* Taking charge of a particular geography or type of business, to grow our presence and tailor our platform to that group's specific needs.
* Managing a new growth initiative – from specifying and designing content to launching and measuring the impact.
* Helping to answer customer support queries (we all pitch in with this).

About You

* You might be a recent graduate, or looking to move after a few years working in another industry.
* You have a degree from a top university.
* You’re ambitious and want to help build something large – if you do well, you’ll be leading a team before you know it.
* You're comfortable with numbers, and know your way around Excel.
* You’ve had hands-on experience at a business, running a society or on a side project (bonus points if you’ve done some digital marketing). 
* Fluency in another language is a bonus, but not required.
* You have the right to work in the UK (we’re based in Central London) – unfortunately we're not able to  sponsor visas right now.

* IMPORTANT: How to Apply

We a couple of questions to help us get to know you, so please apply here: https://jobs.tab.travel

We a couple of questions to help us get to know you, so please apply here: https://jobs.tab.travel

jobs.title: Lead Engineer
jobs.description:
Tab helps tourist businesses take bookings and get paid.

We make tools for places like hostels, boutique hotels, dive schools and surf lodges that simplify their lives, help them compete with bigger outfits and make their customers happy! Our goal is to boost local tourism, while helping backpackers and independent travellers make the most of their precious time abroad.

Our experienced team have backgrounds in startups and finance and founded Tab whilst in Y Combinator in 2015.
Requirements

We're searching for a lead engineer to join us in our central London office (near Oxford Circus), to work across our entire platform, and ultimately lead a team of three developers.

This will be a hands-on management position: as a team leader first and a developer second, your main focus will be leading a team and helping organise its work to make great products whilst ensuring code quality, test coverage, and a sustainable working environment.

You will also be a key contributor to:

- architectural planning (inc. security & data)
- product design
- continually improving development methodology
- further recruitment

We want to find someone who:

- is excited by the chance to build something new as one of the first 15 team members at an early-stage startup within a fun market
- would like a careful, methodical workplace where technical decisions are made with due process rather than hopping on the latest shiny bandwagon
- thinks every good feature deserves a unit test or two
- believes in refactoring (because tomorrow will come)
- has opinions on product design
- wants to get involved in hiring

You should have a minimum of 18 months experience leading a small team, ideally in another startup or small company.

Our main backend & web stack: Python, JavaScript, ReactJS, Postgres.

What are we working on?

- Tools for small business owners that really care about what they do, and the travellers they meet
- Cross-platform development, on the web and across a large range of mobile devices
- The next generation of fraud detection, focussing on the specific issues of the travel market
- Reliable systems that have to work all over the world 24/7
- Scaling for expansion!

What will you get?

- A salary between £50,000–£70,000, depending on experience
- Generous stock options in a YC-backed startup
- £1k annual training budget to spend on training or conferences
- Flexible hours
- Opportunities to travel and meet our customers
- Weekly team social lunch, plus other team events

...plus the freedom to make a big impact, quickly.


We know you will be interviewing with other companies, and we like to move quickly anyway! We will give an answer to all applicants within ten working days (subject to your own availability).

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.description:
Tab helps tourist businesses take bookings and get paid.

We make tools for places like hostels, boutique hotels, dive schools and surf lodges that simplify their lives, help them compete with bigger outfits and make their customers happy! Our goal is to boost local tourism, while helping backpackers and independent travellers make the most of their precious time abroad.

Our experienced team have backgrounds in startups and finance and founded Tab whilst in Y Combinator in 2015.
Requirements
What are we looking for?

We're searching for a full-stack engineer to join us in our central London office (near Oxford Circus), to work across our entire platform, from public-facing web apps, to internal tools, APIs, third-party systems & services.

Our backend & web stack: Python, JavaScript, ReactJS, Postgres.

We want to find someone who:

- is excited by the chance to build something new as one of the first 15 team members at an early-stage startup within a fun market
- would like a careful, methodical workplace where technical decisions are made with due process rather than hopping on the latest shiny bandwagon
- thinks every good feature deserves a unit test or two
- believes in refactoring (because tomorrow will come)
- has opinions on product design

You should have years of software development experience across backend systems and the web. Experience with smartphones and other platforms is a bonus.

Tab is based in central London, so you must have the existing right to work within the UK (we cannot currently sponsor a work visa), but there will be opportunities to travel to exciting places to experience the product and meet users.
What will you be working on?

- Tools for small business owners that really care about what they do, and the travellers they meet
- Cross-platform development, on the web and across a big range of mobile devices
- The next generation of fraud detection, focussing on the specific issues of the travel market
- Reliable systems that have to work all over the world 24/7
- Scaling for expansion!

What will you get?

- A salary between £40,000–£60,000, depending on experience
- Generous stock options in a YC-backed startup
- £1k annual training budget to spend on training or conferences
- Flexible hours
- Opportunities to travel and meet our customers
- Weekly team social lunch, plus other team events

...plus the freedom to make a big impact, quickly.


We know you will be interviewing with other companies, and we like to move quickly anyway!

We will give an answer to all applicants within ten working days (subject to your own availability).


If you would like to learn more before applying, please email us at jobs@tab.travel
